lines.text:
[First lines]
When I look back on my childhood, I wonder how my brothers and I managed to survive at all. It was, of course, a miserable childhood. The happy childhood is hardly worth telling. Worse than the ordinary miserable childhood is the miserable Irish childhood. And worse still is the miserable Irish Catholic childhood.
Forgive me, Father, for I have sinned. It's been a minute since my last confession.
In the name of the father, the son and the holy toast.

If I were in America I could say "I love you, dad", the way they do in the films. But in Limerick they'd laugh at you. In Limerick you are only allowed to say you love God, and babies, and horses that win. Anything else is softness in the head.
If I were able I would go to work in the English factories.
Factory's no place for a woman Angela.
Sittin' on your arse is no place for a man Malachy.

[Showing Oliver a painting of Jesus]
That's the baby Jesus. And if you ever need anything, you should pray to him.

[Whispered to Frankie]
Could you tell Jesus that we're hungry?
Shut up!
It was the first time my father ever kissed me. I felt so happy I could float.
It's poor I am. It's unlucky I am. But it's useless I am not.
Don't let anyone ever slam the door on you again. Do you hear me?
I do.
[the twins are crying]
Look at my bum!
Stop showing your bum!
I was just trying to make them laugh!
What is it, Malachy?
It's a beautiful wee girl, Mrs. Liebowitz! After four boys, can you believe it? A wee girl.
I was thinking of calling him Alphonsius.
Alphonsius? That's a stupid name!
I wouldn't give the English the steam off my pish!

[after Malachy makes weak excuses for returning from England with no money]
You drank the money, Da.
You drank the money.
You drank the money.

[to Frank]
You're wearin me dead mothers dress!

[drunk, yelling at Angela]
Every night you went up there! Squeak Squeak Squeak with Laman Griffin!

[confessing to Francis of Assisi as a priest listens]
I hit my mother...
He's fatter than the baby Jesus!
Lord, you might be scrawny, but that's a fine boyo you have there.
